availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Cowherd (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Yelverton Cowherd. Married to Elvira C. Gaines Cowherd in Green County, Kentucky, on February 5, 1857. Father of Robert Y. Cowherd and John G. Cowherd. Laborer in Taylor County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in Taylor County in 1850. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 2.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 69A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 5, p. 259D.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Green County Marriages, Film 000594378.
"A Serious Game of Croquet," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), August 25, 1875, p. 4.
"The Shelbyville Fair," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), August 31, 1875, p. 3.
